title: unable to select digital keyboard - moto x style

thread.text:
When using the Facebook Messenger app, What's App or my phone's messenger app, I am no long able to select the keyboard. I can select pictures or emoji's but when I click on the text bar, the digital keyboard doesn't pop up. I have a Motorola X Style running Android 7.0. I have tried deleting the app, using a third party keyboard app (Swift) clearing app data and even doing a factory reset. Nothing has worked
There is nothing wrong with my screen, as I can use the keyboard perfectly when in Google Chrome. When I tilt the screen, it is possible to use the keyboard in messenger. Could anyone please help me with this, as it is very annoying.
Thank you.

title: What to do when phone doesn't get repaired even in 2 months

thread.text: It's been 2 months and service centre has not yet returned my phone. I'm about to file a consumer forum case.. Do I have another choice ?

title: How do I avoid having to reboot my phone daily in order to get 'Phone audio' enabled on Bluetooth?

thread.text:
Hi all
I'm having this strange (but really frustrating) Bluetooth bug on my Motorola Moto X Style (XT1572) with Android 6.0. I already tried restoring the Phone to factory settings and without any extra apps but the issue persists. It just suddenly started happening (about a month ago).
Nothing has changed in the bluetooth devices that I use with my Phone. I connect my car using Bluetooth and if I'm not in my car, I use a Bluetooth hands free kit to make and receive my Phone calls.
About a month ago my bluetooth started acting weird. When I'm in my car and want to make a Phone call, it starts the call on my Phone but then my car says that something went wrong and the call couldn't be initiated, although the call is continued on my phone. I do receive my text messages on my car and can also sent them but I'm unable to make/receive Phone calls.
When I receive Phone calls, they don't come up on my cars media. However, my Phone says its using Bluetooth for the call and the bluetooth connection is up. When I'm having this issue, I can not disconnect the Bluetooth connection with my car on my phone. It refuses to disconnect and I can not switch to any other Bluetooth device. The same goes when I'm having the issue while connected to my other Bluetooth hands free kit. In the advanced bluetooth settings of the bluetooth connection on my Phone, I also noticed that when the issue occurs all Bluetooth functionality is checked (eg. 'Media audio'), except 'Phone audio'. 'Phone audio' is not checked and it refuses to check it (however it's not greyed out). When I tap on 'Phone audio' in order to enable it, you see it getting checked for like a few microseconds and then it instantly gets unchecked again.
The only remedy I found is to power off and start my Phone again. Very frustrating if you want to make a quick Phone call and that you have to wait 5 minutes each time or if someone is trying to reach you but they can't hear you and they keep calling back while you try to press the power off button :-).
I've noticed that when I keep my Phone powered on at night and let it charge, the issue is present. If I recharge my Phone while it's powered of, pull out the power plug and then power on the Phone, there is no issue.
It seems to me that it has something to do with the update process...
Any idea how I can solve this issue?
Previously I did had other bluetooth issues like sudden switches between the phone's speaker and the bluetooth hands free (without any clear reason), it would just switch the bluetooth audio off and on again. So imagine, I'm calling someone with my hands free kit and suddenly the sound is gone. I grab my Phone and hear the other person talking, I continue the conversation using my phone's sound, then the sound is gone again and I need to continue with my handsfree. Other times when the phone said it was using bluetooth audio, it actually wasn't and I had to select 'Phone speaker' and then bluetooth audio again to get audio via bluetooth.
I don't think it has got anything to do with my car's bluetooth or my handsfree because the handsfree works flawlessly with my laptop and the car's bluetooth also works perfect with my partners Phone.
Welcome to the forums. Did you get an update before this happened?

Go to settings > location > press the 3 dots on the upper right > scanning,
And turn off the "Bluetooth Scanning"

title: Random reboots even after factory reset....

thread.text:
Hello,
I have my Moto X Style for a little less than one year. Had no problems with it at all, enjoyed it a lot, until about 3 weeks ago. It then started to randomly reboot, 3 or 4 times a day. I searched on Google and saw many people had that issue. Tried several of the "solutions" I found, uninstalled some apps I thought could be the cause, with no success. 
2 days ago, I decided to do a factory reset. Looked like it worked, for one day. Yesterday, it did reboot once again, only one time though. And now, it just rebooted again a few seconds ago...
What can I do now? The dull thing is that every time it reboots, I lose the Bluetooth association with my devices and have to reassociate them, like the sound system in my car, and it sucks to enter the 0000 code and then having to add the player to the "trusted devices" and all....
Phone is not rooted and running system (Android 6.0 with Dec. 1st security) . Build #MPHS24.49-18-16.
Thanks for any input.

title: Contacts names dont show when being called

thread.text:
Hi,
The title says it all, when Im being called, there is no name shown, just the phone number of this person, this is really annoying.
Ive been having this issue since android 6.0.
I have a Motorola Moto X style.

replies.text: What region are you in and what format are the phone numbers in?

thread.text: Welcome to Android Central! Does this happen even for callers who are saved in your Contacts app?

Take a look at this thread and see if any of those fixes work for you. http://forums.androidcentral.com/sho...d.php?t=619296
6.0 Marshmallow: Contacts are not being recognized in calls log and incoming calls
as far as I know, I havent saved any contacts in my contacts app, I always save them to my google account.
And are your Google Contacts syncing with the phone? Do they show up in the Contacts app?
They show up in my contacts app yes, tried deleting partition cache but that didnt work either.

Are all callers showing up as only phone numbers, or only one? Are all of these callers's phone numbers already entered into your Google Contacts? Or could they be alternate numbers they're calling from, which aren't yet in your Google Contacts?

This happened to multiple people, around 10 I think, so I'm pretty sure this applies for everyone.
All of my numbers are in my google contacts, so I dont know whats up with that.
Ok, try wiping the cache partition as a general troubleshooting step: https://motorola-global-en-aus.custh...p/30,6720,9541
Tried this earlier, it didnt resolve the problem, so I dont think it will when I do it now.

Whoops, sorry--I missed that in your earlier post.
How about going to Settings>Accounts, removing your Google account, then adding it back again?
that worked! thank you very much
Worked for me too cheers

title: Moto X Style - Sim card stopped working after 15 minutes

thread.text: Hi. Yesterday I have purchased Moto X Style. My sim card was a micro and it must be converted to nano. I have gave my number and friend cut it with a special tool which has been created for this purpose. I have put it inside the sim card slot and it worked normally. But, after 15 minutes it has stopped working unexpectedly. It shows that "No Sim Card". I have tried to put card out and in again and again... But nothing helps
Welcome to Android Central! It probably was cut incorrectly, or the card may have been damaged in the process. Get a new nano-SIM from your carrier.

replies.text: I will check different sim tomorrow. Is there any chance that phone was damaged ?

thread.text: I doubt it, unless perhaps some fragments of the card broke off and lodged in the SIM slot.
I have bought new nano sim. And it didin't work.  What does that mean?
Does it still say No Sim Card? What carrier are you using?

Yes, exactly. It is local carrier. The main point is that sim card and it slot are stretched when I pin out it from the phone. I don't know why. When I have watched inside the phone with flashlight, I saw that some elements are curved. And it looks like it is defect. What I must do?

Where did you purchase the phone from? The easiest thing to do would be to return it to the seller and ask for a refund or exchange. If you bought it used and the seller refuses to take it back, then you could try contacting Motorola for warranty repair.

title: U3 vs U1 card for Moto X Style 16 GB, Using it as Adoptable Storage.

thread.text:
Hi,
So I'm planning on getting a Moto X Style White which is now only available in 16GB (32 GB has been out of stock for way too long) and So I;m thinking that I'll get an sd card to use as an Adoptable Storage Device.
I've heard a lot about both the Samsung pro+ (U3) and the Samsung Evo+ (U1), the only problem is in my country only the 64GB variant of the Pro+ is available, whereas the 128GB version of the Evo is availble as well. 
So my question is whether the performance increase from using the Pro+ U3 above is significant enough to warrant the reduced storage availability? Or will the performance be just a minor increase and I should get the 128 Gig Evo instead?
Thanks for the help

replies.text:
In my opinion the performance increase is not going to be that noticeable. Get the 128 model if that's what you want, which seems to be the case. 
Let us know how things go.

title: Moto x style -Touch screen issues after turbo charging

thread.text:
I have ordered X Style and yesterday I got it. There was a turbo charger inside the box. But, it has 3 pins. And in my country 2 pins is a standart. So, I had to use a converter.
Anyway, after charging the phone the problems begin to rise. Left and the right side of the screen are completely not reacting to touch events. But after 30 minutes it seems ok. Could turbo charger be a reason? My brother has Nexus 6 turbo charger with 2 pins. But, it is 0.5A. But, my charger is 0.7A. Can I use it?
What I must do?
Thanks.

title: Anyone gone from nexys 6p to x style

thread.text:
Title meant to say Nexus 
I have a 6P. 32gB.. and yes its good... but its like a flat black slab in my hand and growing a little ugle now, whereas the MXStyle seems more shapely and it has an SDCard..
My question is.. what about the camera... is the camera as good as the EIS on the 6p, also Ive read reviews that say the speakers do get a little distorted at high volums on the pure / style... however, these reviews are from release day... and theres been some updates since then.. so
Whats your opinion pls on audio and camera?

Had a chance to try an X Style out... Im sticking with the 6P.. yes its a bit big in the hand and the audio on the X has a more rounded fuller sound... I just find the OS on the 6P faster, and much more responsive and not so sluggish asit is on the X.. also the camera is better on the 6P..plus Android N is coming to the 6P in the UK very soon, but no evidence of it on the style.. However, I did like the Moto voice feature, very cool, reminds me of Cortana on my 950XL.. 
So Im sticking 6P.. for now

title: Android apps like Lumia Refocus, Panorama and others?

title: Moto X Style Heating issues

thread.text:
Hello everyone,
I own Moto X Stytle (Indian Version). Truly love this phone.
1. Old Unit
There are some serious heating issues need your comments.
So last month I've ordered & then upgraded to Android Marshmallow.
On 5 min usage the phone heated up like hot cake. Even if I play low end games like candy crush saga or temple run or subway surfers & when I played asphalt airborne that went even higher.
Cooler Master temperate was 46.5 C and CPUz was close to 47 C
So I called up to get the unit replaced.New Unit
Now I've the new unit (upgraded to Android Marshmallow)
Same issue but the temperate is bit lesser even then touches around 45 C (Cooler Master and CPUz score) on 5 - 10 mins use
My new units AnTuTu Benchmark score is over 69k. There are some lags When I play games like candy crush saga but these are not much seen when I play asphalt airborne or modern combat
Even while browsing or using wifi the temperature moves upto 42 C
When the unit heats I cant take up calls as the screen is very hot. The heat are on both sides of the phone. Front side feel are more.
Are these normal or even my new unit is bad one.
2. There are some lags on the new unit while using applications.
3. Here comes the battery life (I've the screen brightness to almost minimum around 15%)
Normal use > about 1 day
Mixed use > 12 hrs
Heavy games > 5 hrs max
So is this hardware fault or do you think Motorola / Lenovo would come up with an update to solve the issue.
Can you help as I'm bit scared as this one my first high end phone.
Thanks in advance.

Depending on what games you play it could get hot. Angry Birds 2 will heat it to 110F easily, lots of YouTube or browsing maybe 100F. 
I assume these temps are without connection to the turbo charger?
Battery life decent, light use 1 day, medium use needs topping off in the afternoon, heavy use around 6-7 hours?
Do you mean heating up in only 5 mins use is normal in Moto X Style

What the max temperature your phone has recorded
1. Heavy use
2. Moderate use
Mine are as on Cooler Master and CPUz
Heavy use - 45 C
Moderate use - upto 42 C
Post your comments

Mine temp reading once reached 49 deg cel n then on i have stopped using navigation, was driving for 3-4 hrs.. 
Scared if it blows off some day due such heat issue.
Has anyone found a way to tackle this issue

I have the moto x force & my phone was hearing up quickly the other day & my battery life was shorter too. Found out it was the Facebook app causing problems so deleted it & installed metal instead. Now my phone is back to normal & never goes above 40 degrees C unless it's turbo charging.
Posted via the Android Central App

title: Light user battery expectancy

thread.text:
Hey all,
I'm considering the Moto Style but have some concerns over the 3000mah battery, shall we say, less than favourable reports!
As I'm what you would class as a light user - would it be unreasonable to expect a full day out of it? 
Another question: Antenna strength. Would someone give me a quick run-down as to how good the antenna is in the Moto Play? My iPhone 6s seems weaker than other phones in my household. Heck - even my back-up Moto G 3rd gen has a better antenna than my iPhone 6s. 
Many thanks.

My X Style easily gets me through a day. When Doze kicks in, the battery is amazing. Just dont go running around and expect 4hrs of sot on full brightness...
Coming from an LG G2, I was kinda spoiled batterylife wise. The Moto X charges so fast however, that I dont mind the 'smaller' battery..
From my Moto X Style

title: Why can't my phone play music?

thread.text: I have been having issues with my Moto X Style. I upgraded it to Marshmallow and started experiencing audio problems. Once in a while, Google play music gives me an "audio playback error" while black player doesn't play anything. The ringtones and notification sounds do not work either. After further investigation I found that this problem only arose when I had Facebook's messenger app installed. I need messenger for keeping in touch with my friends but at the same time the error is quite annoying and makes me miss important calls. Any suggestions and help will be great.
Firstly restore your phone ,I always recommend to restore after every Android upgrade i.e 4.4 to 5.0 or 5.0 to 6.0,

title: Moto X Style/Pure Edition SD card & SIM tray problem?

thread.text:
I recently bought a Moto X Style and found the SIM tray didn't 'pop' out, only open slightly, so I had to prize it out with a thin piece of plastic. I also found my Samsung 32GB Evo Micro SDHC didn't work in it, however that card did work in my 2013 Moto G. As a result I returned the phone to Amazon UK on case I had a faulty unit and ordered another.
Having received a replacement I've found the same problems, so wanted to share this with others. Does anyone else find their SIM tray near impossible to remove, and has anyone else tried this SD card in their Moto X?
As an aside, I've just swapped from a Nexus 6P to a Moto X Style (as I missed the Moto features) and it's surprising how big the size difference is. Moto is so much smaller than the 6P and so much nicer to hold.
Posted via the Android Central App

Hi, I can only really comment on the sim card tray as I don't use an SD card but it shouldn't really pop out, cause if it did you might drop it on the floor and loose it. I agree it's quite difficult to get it in and out, but once you manage to pull the tray out and put your sim in it, you probably won't be accessing that part of the phone too often. 
As for the SD card, when you put it in the phone does it just not recognize it? have you tried formatting the card?

anyone know whether x pure and style share the same sim card tray? i got a pure its sim card tray has 2 sim card slots but the top one has been covered by plastic,wondered if that one can read sim card?

The SIM tray doesn't pop out all the way when using the SIM ejector tool. It only comes out enough for you to use your nail to slide it off.
As for the Samsung MicroSD card... I had the same issue when formatting it to be part of the internal storage. Regardless how many times I tried, I kept getting the error that the card was too slow even though it was a Class 10.
I replaced it with a Class 10 SanDisk, and it went through the process without any issues. So try changing your card like I did.
Actually, you can press the tool a little harder, and the tray will just pop right out
I have a samsung evo 64 gb card and it works just fine. I have it configured as external storage.

title: Motorola has the worst customer and after sale service, can I please get some help?

thread.text: I have not seen such a pathetic service. I submitted my moto x style on 4 jan due to a faulty display. It has been more than 70 days and still my phone is not repaired. They are saying that the part isn't available. I don't know what to do. I just want my phone back.
Are there any cosumer-protection laws that you could leverage? You could call them (provided you have another phone) and escalate to a manager.

2 of my Moto X Style are with Motorola/Lenovo for last 2 months, for change of cracked display. They have just been promising a date, postponing it, promising a new date. No commitments, no promises kept till date. Completely useless and pathetic after sales service and support (At least in India). 
This was my last phone of Moto, with this experience, I am neither buying nor recommending Moto to anyone ever.

title: Defective battery?

thread.text:
Had my Moto X Style for about a month now it's an absolutely brilliant phone but the battery life SUCKS
Been getting no more than 2 hours screen on time and little more than 5 hours with moderate usage and can barely hit 12 hours before it dies under light usage. As for standby time, even with the marshmallow update I've gone to bed with 100% battery and woken up with 50% in the morning. I've disabled Moto Voice and Active display and I usually set the screen around 50% brightness.
Just wondering what everyone else's experience is as I'm not sure whether I have a defective battery or if this is just a general issue.
Posted via the Android Central App

Go to Setting/General/Battery. Take a screenshot. Tap the graph to go to the second page and take a screenshot. Post them. (See How To Post Screenshots on Android Central.) We need to see what's happening.

Well it seems to be behaving today despite some fairly moderate usage but here we go anyway
Posted via the Android Central App
Two things: it looks like your signal is poor and you have apps keeping your phone awake even when your phone screen is off. Both really hurt battery life.

title: What does pure android mean?

thread.text:
Thinking about getting a moto phone next year as I like the bigger battery. But what does pure android experience mean with these phones? The only minus thing is that's it's bigger than my phone which is a Samsung galaxy S4. Need something the same size really but the moto x style, moto x play & moto x force all seem really good what I've read. Can't find these phones on EE's website unfortunately. So what does pure android experience mean?
Posted via Android Central App

A good basic definition is that a "Pure Android" device has no carrier bloatware/no added apps.
Just Google apps are on the device. 
The Nexus line is the best example of this.
Mav.

That sounds good to me but dunno if I can get one of the moto phones I mentioned on my first post with a carrier like EE or Vodafone etc? So if the phone is 16GB's I'll get near enough the 16GB's? My S4 is 16GB's but only got 9.25GB's to use which is nearly all used up.
Posted via Android Central App

I highly recommend getting a phone with minimum 32GB. Even if you have an SD card, you'll need space for the OS and even the the most basic apps.
I don't know anything about Europe and Motorola phone availability. But, pure Android is the way to go. Skins on top of Android like Samsung's TouchWiz suck.
Let us know what happens. 
Posted via the Android Central App

Went to the carphone warehouse today to look at these 3 phones & I loved them. They are a bit bigger than my phone so would have to get use to the size of it. I played around a lot with the moto x style & it had 24GB's left out of what i think is 32GB. Not bad on the memory, definitely a lot more than what I had available on my Samsung S4 as I only had 9GB. This phone is looking very likely for my next phone next year. I'm hoping it will be a bit cheaper next year too.
Also does this phone have a battery percentage so I know how much battery I have left etc? 
Posted via Android Central App

If you get an app called percent enabler from the play store you can see the level in the battery icon.
Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text:
Cool will have to check that out when I get either the moto x style or force. Thanks. 
Posted via Android Central App

thread.text:
It looks like this by the way.
Posted via the Android Central App

If you have Marshmallow 6.0 you can have the percentage in the battery icon without adding an app. You need to enable System UI Tuner.
Pull down the notification shade and long-press on the Settings gear icon for about 5 seconds then let go. You should see a pop-up with the message “Congrats! System UI Tuner has been added to Settings.” Now you cam go nto settings, scroll to the bottom, and find an option for System UI Tuner. Among other things, there's auln option to display the percentage in the battery icon.

replies.text:
I heard about this trick. Doesn't a message come up saying some things may brake or something along those lines?
Posted via Android Central App

Hi, 
My wife was looking to upgrade her Note 3 a month ago, she was with EE. She decided to leave and go to O2 as they had the Nexus 5x, which she wanted. Nexus & Moto offer very similar devices (pure Android) the sales rep from EE told me that in 2016 they plan on getting the Moto X, Moto G, Nexus 6p and Nexus 5x so maybe by the time you are ready for a new phone they might have it. 
Pure Android is the way to go, it's fast, smooth and looks good. Other companies like Samsung, HTC, Sony all run Android, but they have their own version of how it should look. 
As for storage, every phone uses up some space for the current operating system it's running, but pure Android devices will have more available as they don't have bloatware like Samsung, HTC and Sony offer. 
I currently have the Moto X Style and love it - my wife's Nexus 5x is also awesome so you can't go wrong  it might be worth while checking out the Nexus 5x as it's smaller and lighter than the Moto phones.

I'm with EE at the mo but when I popped in one of the stores to return my power bar I looked at there phones & they had both Nexus devices. Don't think I saw any moto phones though. Not sure if I should get the phone from EE or the carphone warehouse as EE will probably but a load of bloatware on which I don't want. My S4 has loads of bloatware on it & only left me 9GB which is nearly full, have to keep clearing the cashe every month.
Posted via Android Central App

Oh, and to answer your question, no - nothing will break  when you press and hold on the settings wheel, it gives you some UI tweaks in the settings menu. The only two useful ones are being able to display the percentage of the battery in the battery icon and having the ability to arrange the quick toggles in the drop down menu.

thread.text: The message says something like things may break, be removed or added in the future. It only applies to the options added by System UI Tuner. Don't worry, ignore it. The same exact things could be said about any app you install.
Hi, I'm not sure if they would put bloatware on the phone, on your S4 - do you have EE bloatware? Either way I would suggest going with Carphone Warehouse, they usually can get you a decent deal

replies.text:
It's either EE putting the bloatware on or Samsung when I've had updates for my S4. I think Deezer is to do with EE & I've had Deezer since I got the phone. Never had kids mode before & that appeared after an update. Was thinking of going with the carphone warehouse coz when I looked at the moto x style & the moto x force they had about 24GB's left. Seems ok for me. Much more than 9GB's.

title: Battery life for Moto X Style/Pure after Marshmallow update

thread.text:
Those who have updated their Moto X Style to Marshmallow 6.0, can you tell me your experience with the battery life before and after updating.
Though I have updated my device also, I don't see much of a difference in battery life. May be I could not see it.
Hence, anyone with a valid experience can share it here.
I got my phone on monday.. and I got the marshmallow update just when I turned the phone on.. my battery has lasted me quite well with moderate use.But still its not above average.

Getting good battery life after marshmallow.... This is with data disabled and on WiFi for whole day.
Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text: How many hours of sot did that equate to?
It took me through the whole day.. Approx 12 13 hours..
Great but how many hours of screen on time was that?

thread.text: I haven't noticed much of a difference, but my battery was decent before 6.0 and it continues to be decent. I guess I can see that it's got slightly better, I no longer drop much when I take it off the charge first thing in the morning, before it would drop to 99% instantly.

title: Music player does not mute when I receive a call on my Moto X style/pure edition (Marshmallow), how can I fix this?

thread.text: Usually when you are listening to music and you happen to receive a call the music playback is interrupted and the ringtone is played...but this is not happening in my phone...even though the phone vibrates and the call is displayed on my screen there are chances for the call to go unnoticed when am using an earphone. Could someone provide a solution to this so that the music playback is interrupted when I receive a call...or are there chances that my phone is faulty??
Hi, does this happen all the time or just once? I have tested out the above to see if I had the problem and I don't.

title: Moto x style: Turbo Charger?

thread.text:
I just noticed that the moto x style international have a 3 Pin Mains Adapter... where the hell do I connect this to?? (I live in israel)
If this is the international version of the phone, why do I get a charger with 3 pins??? I have no where to connect this to, and my phone is already being shipped by CLOVE
Got this reply from clove:Then told them why not put a 2 pin charger for me the first placeJust great!!
Now I cant enjoy a fast phone charging.What am I suppose to do now?

replies.text:
Why did you buy it from a UK site? of course a UK retailer is going to ship with a UK plug. Could you imagine all the thousands of people that bought a Moto X from Clove who live in the UK didn't get a UK plug??
The Moto X Style is the international version of the US Moto X Pure - buy your products direct from Moto if you want the charger compatible with your country or better yet, buy it from a retail store in Israel.

thread.text:
An adapter shouldn't affect charging speed.
Posted via Android Central App

title: What camera option to use?

thread.text:
What camera should I use on the Moto X Style and why?
A) 21MP with 4:3 ratio.
B)16,1MP with 16:9 ratio.

title: Why aren't my photos updating in the native gallery or any app?

thread.text:
Hi,
I'm using Moto X for past 1 week. Completely satisfied with phone. Only thing not satisfied is about some problems with Photos and gallery app. 
I was saving in all photos and videos in sd card in my previous phone Asus Zenfone 5 (1st gen). Now the folder have some 800 odd pics (1.22 GB) and 90 odd videos (6.8 GB). it was working fine with the native Asus Gallery app or Quick pic (before CM lab takeover). But this is not working in Moto X. I tried with native gallery, Photos and all the top line 3rd party apps for this. I can see the pic when i restart the phone and open the app, if i close and reopen its all blank squares only as thumbnails.I formatted the sd card and copied all the pics once again and checked still the same issue.
Is this a problem of reading from SD card or is it bcos of too many items in one folder. If latter is the case a weaker phone Asus was handling it nicely.
Anyone could help on this. 
Thanks in advance
Welcome to Android Central! The problem might be with the card itself. Have you tried a different card?

title: Why £399 not £359

thread.text:
Hi,
Why has the price for the Moto X Style gone up in the UK?? It was predicted to be £359, but now you can pre-order the Moto X Style off the Motorola store (32 GB, no additional things/covers) for £399!! This is just too much as it contradicts all the predictions, and it isn't such a good-value-for-money phone as advertised. It also doesn't match up with the exchange rate between pounds and dollars, as the phone costs $399. If the £399 was to be accurately converted to dollars, it would cost over $600. I have emailed the Motorola support team and I am waiting for a reply.
Has anyone got any theories/ideas why this has happened? It has really ruined the idea that the phone was at an affordable price, as it isn't so much now, at least not for people in the UK.

replies.text:
I have payed € 499,99 for my 32 GB retail Black version. I'm happy with the choice I made coming from the OnePlus One, but the price should have been lower. The main reason is, because in certain countries you pay the retail price and not the price from direct distribution channel like Moto Maker. I live in Belgium and would love to had the choice making my own Moto X Style, but I didn't got the option to do so.
Posted via the Android Central App

thread.text: Just to clarify, these were predictions, correct?

I was surprised to see the phone priced at £399 but was glad to see it was the 32GB option and not the 16GB option, which is offered as the base spec in America. For the memory upgrade there they charge an extra $50 so we are paying a little more for those extra 16GB. 
This won't be the first or last device where the UK advertised price is at a £1 to $1 rate and I've sort of come to expect it. One thing to bare in mind is that VAT is added on top of the US price while it is included in the UK price. Our VAT is also 20% while I think it is typically below or 10% in the states. 
So if you subtract 20% tax and downgrade the memory (subtract $50) the UK price is £299.89 compared to a converted US price of £260.21. Yes it is more and there maybe other factors like import duties, exchange rate flucation, and operating costs for the smaller market that I have not considered but in general it is not as bad as it first looks.
Posted via the Android Central App
Well Clove technology UK are selling this phone in black 32gb for £350 so that is where I will buy mine from and it looks great in black but black is your only choice.

That is a good deal. I really wanted one with a wood back but it is hard to justify an extra £70 for it.
Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text: I agree it is hard to justify and the phone looks great in black.

thread.text:
Got a reply from Motorola, this is what they said:This does seem to make sense, but I am still quite suprised at just how big the taxes, import prices and regulation costs are.
What do you guys think? Also I'm not 100% what they mean when they say the phones are not the same. I thought that the Moto X Pure Edition WAS the Moto X Style, just working on all USA carriers and not purchasable from carriers, am I missing something??

replies.text: The phones may have different radio bands though I don't know for sure. The US uses different LTE bands than most of the rest of the world. I've picked up phones over there before but the LTE doesn't work back here but at the time it didn't matter to me but now it does. I'm not sure how this would really impact the price though so I'd personally say it is more down to higher costs from taxes/duties/regulatory stuff as virtually all electronics are cheaper in the states.

I was super excited when this phone was announced as it had the potential to sway me from my iPhone. (Not easy but possible) 
But I think Motorola fluffed the announcement.... No clue as to when pre orders would begin at all for Europe. So I waited , and waited and watched the U.S. Get their pure edition. And still waited ! Getting more annoyed day by day. 
Then Apple announced their 6S along with a preorder timetable and an availability date. That's how it should be done. It reminded me of the great service I get from them in all their stores too. 
I decided to order a 6S plus on pre order day and got a delivery date of Sep 25th. I like clarity and a company that doesn't keep you in the dark like Motorola did. 
And now finally we get a pre order option for the Moro x style (for oct 6th delivery). Not good enough Motorola. 
I was tempted at first and nearly swayed but the gap between announcement and pre order with no indication of the preorder date cost them a sale.

I ordered the Moto x Style yesterday. Was given a delivery date of October 9th. When I check the order status it says the device has already been built and the order is complete. It's now waiting for delivery. Surely it's not going to take until the 9th October to deliver??

I'd say expect it earlier than the 9th maybe by a day or two but I dont think it will be shipped for atleast a week or so.
I could be completely wrong ... just basing it on what the situation with the US orders has been like so far.

1) No orange trim (seriously a big deal, I wouldve preordered now if had orange accents)
2) Battery life appears poor from US reviews. I have avg 4-5 SOT and this would prob last me until 2pm from leaving the house at 7am. I don't want to be tied to charge even with turbo charging. 
3) The size. I have an N5 now and am comfortable with a slight increase partner has an S6 and that's OK. Just worried it will be too big. Would like some hands on if possible before committing.
4) Some lag seen on other reviews when using Moto Display. Would get annoying at times. My N5 is still pretty snappy only really struggling if using intensive apps. 
Until I see reviews from Alex Dobie and MKBHD I'm on the fence.
Really thought this was my next device so a little downbeat on what I've heard so far but will await the full reviews with baited breath.
